qas.question: What will drying often increase in wood?
What color is also used interchangeably with "undried" for wood?
What type of wood can hold four times as much of a load when dried?

context: Drying produces a decided increase in the <a0_0>strength<a0_0/> of wood, particularly in small specimens. An extreme example is the case of a completely dry <a2_0>spruce<a2_0/> block 5 cm in section, which will sustain a permanent load four times as great as a <a1_0>green<a1_0/> (undried) block of the same size will.
